Dividing images to sequence of pathches#

PatchEmbed#

Extraction of patches from series of images (video)

class liedet.models.backbones.timesformer.PatchEmbed(img_size: int | tuple[int, int], patch_size: int | tuple[int, int], stride: int | tuple[int, int] | None = None, in_channels: int = 3, embed_dims: int = 768, conv_cfg: dict[str, Any] = {'type': 'Conv2d'}, **kwargs)[source]#

Bases: torch.nn.modules.module.Module

Patch Embedding for batch of single images.

((B, C, T, H, W))–
–[Merge B and T dims]–
–[Projection]–
–[Flatten]–
–>((B * T, F))

where F - embedding dim
__init__(img_size: int | tuple[int, int], patch_size: int | tuple[int, int], stride: int | tuple[int, int] | None = None, in_channels: int = 3, embed_dims: int = 768, conv_cfg: dict[str, Any] = {'type': 'Conv2d'}, **kwargs) → None[source]#
Parameters

  • img_size (int | tuple[int, int]) – size of input image.

  • patch_size (int | tuple[int, int]) – size of patch size.

  • stride (int | tuple[int, int] | None, optional) – stride size between patches. If None when patch size is used. Defaults to None.

  • in_channels (int, optional) – number of channels of input image. Defaults to 3.

  • embed_dims (int, optional) – number of embedding features. Defaults to 768.

  • conv_cfg (dict[str, Any], optional) – dictionary of parameters of projection layer. Defaults to dict(type=”Conv2d”).

init_weights() → None[source]#

Lecun norm initialization of projection weights

forward(x: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor[source]#

Projects batch of images to batch of embeddings over time.

Parameters

x (Tensor) – batch of input images

Returns

batch of embeddings

Return type

Tensor

class liedet.models.backbones.ast.PatchEmbed(img_size: int | tuple[int, int], patch_size: int | tuple[int, int], stride: int | tuple[int, int] | None = None, in_channels: int = 3, embed_dims: int = 768, conv_cfg: dict[str, Any] = {'type': 'Conv2d'}, **kwargs)[source]#

Bases: liedet.models.backbones.timesformer.PatchEmbed

Patch Embedding for batch of single images.

((B, C, H, W))–
–[Conv2d]–
–[Flatten]–
–>((B, F))

where F - embedding dim

Transformer#

TransformerEncoder#

class liedet.models.common.transformer.TransformerEncoder(encoder_layer, num_layers, norm=None)[source]#

Bases: torch.nn.modules.transformer.TransformerEncoder

Wrapper of torch TransformerEncoder.

The class allows to create transformer from config file.

Attention Layers#

DividedTemporalAttentionWithNorm#

class liedet.models.common.transformer.DividedTemporalAttentionWithNorm(embed_dims: int, num_heads: int, num_frames: int, attn_drop: float = 0.0, proj_drop: float = 0.0, dropout_layer: dict[str, Any] = {'drop_prob': 0.1, 'type': 'DropPath'}, norm_cfg: dict[str, Any] = {'type': 'LN'}, init_cfg: dict[str, Any] | None = None, **kwargs)[source]#

Bases: mmcv.runner.base_module.BaseModule

Temporal Attention in Divided Space Time Attention.

__init__(embed_dims: int, num_heads: int, num_frames: int, attn_drop: float = 0.0, proj_drop: float = 0.0, dropout_layer: dict[str, Any] = {'drop_prob': 0.1, 'type': 'DropPath'}, norm_cfg: dict[str, Any] = {'type': 'LN'}, init_cfg: dict[str, Any] | None = None, **kwargs)[source]#
Parameters

  • embed_dims (int) – Dimensions of embedding.

  • num_heads (int) – Number of parallel attention heads in TransformerCoder.

  • num_frames (int) – Number of frames in the video.

  • attn_drop (float) – A Dropout layer on attn_output_weights. Defaults to 0.0.

  • proj_drop (float) – A Dropout layer after nn.MultiheadAttention. Defaults to 0.0.

  • dropout_layer (dict) – The dropout_layer used when adding the shortcut. Defaults to dict(type=’DropPath’, drop_prob=0.1).

  • norm_cfg (dict) – Config dict for normalization layer. Defaults to dict(type=’LN’).

  • init_cfg (dict | None) – The Config for initialization. Defaults to None.

init_weights() → None[source]#

Constant weights initialization of temporal linear layer.

forward(query: torch.Tensor, key=None, value=None, residual=None, **kwargs) → torch.Tensor[source]#

Forwards Divided Temporal Attention with Normalization

(Input)–[Extract Class Token]–>(Initial Class Token)

(Input without Class Token)–

–[Normalization]– –[Temporal Attention]– –[Dropout]– –[Temporal Linear]– –[Identity]– –[Add Initial Class Token]–

–>(Output)

Parameters

query (Tensor) – input time sequence.

Returns

output time sequence.

Return type

Tensor

Temporal Attention in Divided Space Time Attention.

__init__(embed_dims: int, num_heads: int, num_frames: int, attn_drop: float = 0.0, proj_drop: float = 0.0, dropout_layer: dict[str, Any] = {'drop_prob': 0.1, 'type': 'DropPath'}, norm_cfg: dict[str, Any] = {'type': 'LN'}, init_cfg: dict[str, Any] | None = None, **kwargs)[source]#
Parameters

  • embed_dims (int) – Dimensions of embedding.

  • num_heads (int) – Number of parallel attention heads in TransformerCoder.

  • num_frames (int) – Number of frames in the video.

  • attn_drop (float) – A Dropout layer on attn_output_weights. Defaults to 0.0.

  • proj_drop (float) – A Dropout layer after nn.MultiheadAttention. Defaults to 0.0.

  • dropout_layer (dict) – The dropout_layer used when adding the shortcut. Defaults to dict(type=’DropPath’, drop_prob=0.1).

  • norm_cfg (dict) – Config dict for normalization layer. Defaults to dict(type=’LN’).

  • init_cfg (dict | None) – The Config for initialization. Defaults to None.

Constant weights initialization of temporal linear layer.

Forwards Divided Temporal Attention with Normalization

(Input without Class Token)–

–[Normalization]– –[Temporal Attention]– –[Dropout]– –[Temporal Linear]– –[Identity]– –[Add Initial Class Token]–

–>(Output)

Feed-Forward#

FFNWithNorm#

class liedet.models.common.transformer.FFNWithNorm(*args, norm_cfg: dict[str, Any] = {'type': 'LN'}, **kwargs)[source]#

Bases: mmcv.cnn.bricks.transformer.FFN

FFN with pre normalization layer.

It apply one normalization layer before forwarding the input data to feed-forward networks.

__init__(*args, norm_cfg: dict[str, Any] = {'type': 'LN'}, **kwargs) → None[source]#
Parameters

  • embed_dims (int) – Dimensions of embedding. Defaults to 256.

  • feedforward_channels (int) – Hidden dimension of FFNs. Defaults to 1024.

  • num_fcs (int, optional) – Number of fully-connected layers in FFNs. Defaults to 2.

  • act_cfg (dict) – Config for activate layers. Defaults to dict(type=’ReLU’)

  • ffn_drop (float, optional) – Probability of an element to be zeroed in FFN. Defaults to 0..

  • add_residual (bool, optional) – Whether to add the residual connection. Defaults to True.

  • dropout_layer (dict | None) – The dropout_layer used when adding the shortcut. Defaults to None.

  • init_cfg (dict | None) – The Config for initialization. Defaults to None.

  • norm_cfg (dict) – Config dict for normalization layer. Defaults to dict(type=’LN’).

forward(x: torch.Tensor, residual=None) → torch.Tensor[source]#

Applies normalization and then forwards the input data to feed-forward networks.

Parameters

x (Tensor) – input tensor.

Returns

output tensor.

Return type

Tensor

Multimodal Transformer#

class liedet.models.backbones.mm_transformer.AttentionBottleneckTransformer(transformers: list[dict[str, Any]] | tuple[dict[str, Any]], embed_dims: int = 768, neck_size: int = 4, cls_only: bool = True, **kwargs)[source]#

Bases: torch.nn.modules.module.Module

Attention Bottleneck Transformer.

This class implements one of advanced methods to explore multiple modalities separately but with sharing information between them.

See also: Attention Bottlenecks for Multimodal Fusion.

__init__(transformers: list[dict[str, Any]] | tuple[dict[str, Any]], embed_dims: int = 768, neck_size: int = 4, cls_only: bool = True, **kwargs)[source]#
Parameters

  • transformers (list[dict[str, Any]] | tuple[dict[str, Any]]) – list of transformer configs.

  • embed_dims (int, optional) – size of embedding. Defaults to 768.

  • neck_size (int, optional) – size of bottleneck which is shared between transformers. Defaults to 4.

  • cls_only (bool, optional) – boolean flag to return only class token. Otherwise the full tensor with class token and features is returned. Defaults to True.

forward(*per_transformer_x: Tensor) → tuple[Tensor, ...] | Tensor[source]#

Forwards input tensors and shared bottleneck to correpsonding transformers.

It also calculates and stores bottleneck for next iteration as mean of bottlenecks after each transformer.

Each transformer takes same shared bottleneck.

Parameters

per_transformer_x (tuple[Tensor, ...]) – tuple of batch inputs for corresponding transformers.

Returns

if cls_only is True when it returns tuple of tensors of features with class token of after each transformer. Otherwise only class token is returned.

Return type

tuple[Tensor, …] | Tensor
